name: Mohammad Goudarzi
content: Mohammad Goudarzi - Monash University View Scopus Profile Mohammad Goudarzi Dr Lecturer, Department of Software Systems & Cybersecurity https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7178-3386 EmailMohammad.Goudarzimonashedu Accepting PhD Students 20172024 Research activity per year Personal profile BiographyDr. Mohammad Goudarzi is a Lecturer (Assistant Professor) in the Department of Software Systems and Cybersecurity at Monash University. Before his current position, he was affiliated with UNSW Sydney and Cybersecurity CRC, where he served as a Senior Research Associate on a joint project with Cisco. He earned his PhD in Computer Science and Engineering from The University of Melbourne. Please Visit my personal website @ https://www.mgoudarzi.info/ for the latest updates, open positions, and projects. Honors/Awards Selected as one of the top 200 young computer science and mathematics scientists by the Heidelberg Laureate Forum (HLF), International (2024).The Monash Faculty Education Excellence Award for Programs that Enhance Learning (FIT5225 - Cloud Computing and Security) (2023).The IEEE TCCLD Outstanding Ph.D. Thesis Award, International (2022).The IEEE TCSC Outstanding Ph.D. Dissertation Award, International (2022).The Oracle Cloud Architect of the Year Award, International (2022).Two research papers are selected among the most popular papers in IEEE Transactions on Mobile Computing (TMC) (CoRE A*), 2022.Computer Science (CS) Research Artefacts Grant, The University of Melbourne, Australia (2022).IEEE Outstanding Service Award, International (2021).The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) ARM Accelerator Grant, International (2021).Rowden White Scholarship - Selected as the Highly Talented Ph.D. Student, The University of Melbourne, Australia (2019).The Iranian National Elites Foundation Award and Prize (top 0.1%), Iran (2015).Monash teaching commitmentDr. Mohammad Goudarzi teaches the following units in the Faculty of IT: FIT5225 (Cloud Computing and Security)FIT5202 (Data Processing for Big Data) Expertise related to UN Sustainable Development Goals In 2015, UN member states agreed to 17 global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all.
